openseries.OpenTimeSeriesÔÉÅ

class openseries.OpenTimeSeries(*, tsdf, timeseries_id, instrument_id, name, valuetype, dates, values, local_ccy, currency, domestic='SEK', countries='SE', markets=None, isin=None, label=None)[source]

Bases: _CommonModel[float]

OpenTimeSeries objects are at the core of the openseries package.

The intended use is to allow analyses of financial timeseries. It is only intended for daily or less frequent data samples.

Parameters:

  • timeseries_id (str) ‚Äì Database identifier of the timeseries.

  • instrument_id (str) ‚Äì Database identifier of the instrument associated with the timeseries.

  • name (str) ‚Äì String identifier of the timeseries and/or instrument.

  • valuetype (ValueType) ‚Äì Identifies if the series is a series of values or returns.

  • dates (Annotated[list[Annotated[str, StringConstraints(strip_whitespace=True, to_upper=None, to_lower=None, strict=True, min_length=10, max_length=10, pattern=^\d{4}-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])-(0[1-9]|[12]\d|3[01])$)]], MinLen(min_length=1)]) ‚Äì Dates of the individual timeseries items. These dates will not be altered by methods.

  • values (Annotated[list[float], MinLen(min_length=1)]) ‚Äì The value or return values of the timeseries items. These values will not be altered by methods.

  • local_ccy (bool) ‚Äì Boolean flag indicating if timeseries is in local currency.

  • tsdf (DataFrame) ‚Äì Pandas object holding dates and values that can be altered via methods.

  • currency (Annotated[str, StringConstraints(strip_whitespace=True, to_upper=True, to_lower=None, strict=True, min_length=3, max_length=3, pattern=^[A-Z]{3}$)]) ‚Äì ISO 4217 currency code of the timeseries.

  • domestic (Annotated[str, StringConstraints(strip_whitespace=True, to_upper=True, to_lower=None, strict=True, min_length=3, max_length=3, pattern=^[A-Z]{3}$)]) ‚Äì ISO 4217 currency code of the user‚Äôs home currency. Defaults to ‚ÄúSEK‚Äù.

  • countries (Annotated[set[Annotated[str, StringConstraints(strip_whitespace=True, to_upper=True, to_lower=None, strict=True, min_length=2, max_length=2, pattern=^[A-Z]{2}$)]], MinLen(min_length=1)] | Annotated[str, StringConstraints(strip_whitespace=True, to_upper=True, to_lower=None, strict=True, min_length=2, max_length=2, pattern=^[A-Z]{2}$)]) ‚Äì (List of) country code(s) according to ISO 3166-1 alpha-2. Defaults to ‚ÄúSE‚Äù.

  • markets (list[str] | str | None) ‚Äì (List of) markets code(s) supported by exchange_calendars. Optional.

  • isin (str | None) ‚Äì ISO 6166 identifier code of the associated instrument. Optional.

  • label (str | None) ‚Äì Placeholder for a name of the timeseries. Optional.

Create a new model by parsing and validating input data from keyword arguments.

self is explicitly positional-only to allow self as a field name.

classmethod from_arrays(name, dates, values, valuetype=ValueType.PRICE, timeseries_id='', instrument_id='', isin=None, baseccy='SEK', *, local_ccy=True)[source]

Create series from a list of dates and a list of values.

Parameters:

  • name (str) ‚Äì String identifier of the timeseries and/or instrument.

  • dates (Annotated[list[Annotated[str, StringConstraints(strip_whitespace=True, to_upper=None, to_lower=None, strict=True, min_length=10, max_length=10, pattern=^\d{4}-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])-(0[1-9]|[12]\d|3[01])$)]], MinLen(min_length=1)]) ‚Äì List of date strings as ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD.

  • values (Annotated[list[float], MinLen(min_length=1)]) ‚Äì Array of float values.

  • valuetype (ValueType) ‚Äì Identifies if the series is a series of values or returns. Defaults to ValueType.PRICE.

  • timeseries_id (str) ‚Äì Database identifier of the timeseries. Optional.

  • instrument_id (str) ‚Äì Database identifier of the instrument associated with the timeseries. Optional.

  • isin (str | None) ‚Äì ISO 6166 identifier code of the associated instrument. Optional.

  • baseccy (Annotated[str, StringConstraints(strip_whitespace=True, to_upper=True, to_lower=None, strict=True, min_length=3, max_length=3, pattern=^[A-Z]{3}$)]) ‚Äì ISO 4217 currency code of the timeseries. Defaults to ‚ÄúSEK‚Äù.

  • local_ccy (bool) ‚Äì Boolean flag indicating if timeseries is in local currency. Defaults to True.

Returns:

An OpenTimeSeries object.

Return type:

Self

classmethod from_df(dframe, column_nmbr=0, valuetype=ValueType.PRICE, baseccy='SEK', *, local_ccy=True)[source]

Create series from a Pandas DataFrame or Series.

Parameters:

  • column_nmbr (int) ‚Äì Using iloc[:, column_nmbr] to pick column. Defaults to 0.

  • valuetype (ValueType) ‚Äì Identifies if the series is a series of values or returns. Defaults to ValueType.PRICE.

  • baseccy (CurrencyStringType) ‚Äì ISO 4217 currency code of the timeseries. Defaults to ‚ÄúSEK‚Äù.

  • local_ccy (bool) ‚Äì Boolean flag indicating if timeseries is in local currency. Defaults to True.

classmethod from_fixed_rate(rate, d_range=None, days=None, end_dt=None, label='Series', valuetype=ValueType.PRICE, baseccy='SEK', *, local_ccy=True)[source]

Create series from values accruing with a given fixed rate return.

Providing a date_range of type Pandas DatetimeIndex takes priority over providing a combination of days and an end date.

Parameters:

  • rate (float) ‚Äì The accrual rate.

  • d_range (DatetimeIndex | None) ‚Äì A given range of dates. Optional.

  • days (int | None) ‚Äì Number of days to generate when date_range not provided. Must be combined with end_dt. Optional.

  • end_dt (dt.date | None) ‚Äì End date of date range to generate when date_range not provided. Must be combined with days. Optional.

  • label (str) ‚Äì Placeholder for a name of the timeseries.

  • valuetype (ValueType) ‚Äì Identifies if the series is a series of values or returns. Defaults to ValueType.PRICE.

  • baseccy (CurrencyStringType) ‚Äì The currency of the timeseries. Defaults to ‚ÄúSEK‚Äù.

  • local_ccy (bool) ‚Äì Boolean flag indicating if timeseries is in local currency. Defaults to True.

Returns:

An OpenTimeSeries object.

Return type:

resample_to_business_period_ends(freq='BME', method='nearest')[source]

Resamples timeseries frequency to the business calendar month end dates.

Stubs left in place. Stubs will be aligned to the shortest stub.

Parameters:

  • freq (Literal['B', 'BME', 'BQE', 'BYE']) ‚Äì The date offset string that sets the resampled frequency. Defaults to BME.

  • method (Literal['pad', 'ffill', 'backfill', 'bfill', 'nearest'] | None) ‚Äì Controls the method used to align values across columns. Defaults to nearest.

  • self (Self)

Returns:

An OpenTimeSeries object.

Return type:

Self

ewma_vol_func(lmbda=0.94, day_chunk=11, dlta_degr_freedms=0, months_from_last=None, from_date=None, to_date=None, periods_in_a_year_fixed=None)[source]

Exponentially Weighted Moving Average Model for Volatility.

https://www.investopedia.com/articles/07/ewma.asp.

Parameters:

  • lmbda (float) ‚Äì Scaling factor to determine weighting. Defaults to 0.94.

  • day_chunk (int) ‚Äì Sampling the data which is assumed to be daily. Defaults to 0.

  • dlta_degr_freedms (int) ‚Äì Variance bias factor taking the value 0 or 1. Defaults to 0.

  • months_from_last (int | None) ‚Äì Number of months offset as positive integer. Overrides use of from_date and to_date. Optional.

  • from_date (dt.date | None) ‚Äì Specific from date. Optional.

  • to_date (dt.date | None) ‚Äì Specific to date. Optional.

  • periods_in_a_year_fixed (DaysInYearType | None) ‚Äì Allows locking the periods-in-a-year to simplify test cases and comparisons. Optional.

  • self (Self)

Returns:

Series EWMA volatility.

Return type:

Series[float]

Parameters:

  • days_in_year (int) ‚Äì The calculation divisor and assumed number of days in a calendar year. Defaults to 365.

  • self (Self)
